description: Design system for replicating the Billing History / modern dashboard UI. Use this file as the single source of truth when building or styling UI in this project.

meta.purpose: High-level design guidelines for AI and developers to replicate a modern, professional, approachable UI. Treat as creative-director-level instructions.
meta.audience: AI code generation, frontend implementation, design consistency

designPrinciples.summary: The interface should feel modern and minimalist, professional and trustworthy, yet approachable and friendly. Every screen must have clear hierarchy, consistent visual language, and excellent readability.

principles.name: Modern & Minimalist
principles.guideline: Clean aesthetic with ample white space, simple iconography, uncluttered layouts. Avoid heavy embellishments; focus on functionality and content.

principles.name: Professional & Trustworthy
principles.guideline: Color palette, typography, and structured presentation convey reliability. Suitable for administrative and data-heavy screens.

principles.name: Approachable & Friendly
principles.guideline: Rounded corners on UI elements, subtle gradients, and soft accents add warmth without sacrificing clarity.

principles.name: Clear Hierarchy
principles.guideline: Use font size, weight, and color to guide attention: main titles → secondary info → detailed data → actions. Never flatten importance.

principles.name: Consistency
principles.guideline: Apply the same typography scale, color usage, spacing increments, and corner radii everywhere. One visual language across the app.

principles.name: Readability
principles.guideline: Strong text contrast, generous spacing in tables and lists, and legible font sizes for all content.

structureAndLayout.pageContainer: Content lives inside a single prominent card-like container. Do not fill the full viewport with raw content.

mainContentCard.description: Primary content block that holds sections (header, table/list, pagination).
rules: One main white card per view/section when appropriate
Lifted appearance via subtle shadow, not heavy borders
Content never bleeds to viewport edges without padding

headerSection.layout: Left: title + optional count + subtitle. Right: primary actions (e.g. Export, Download).
headerSection.rule: Keep title and actions on one row; use flex/grid to separate left and right.

structureAndLayout.dataSection: Tables or lists with clear header row and row separators. No dense walls of text.
structureAndLayout.footerSection: Pagination and/or results summary (e.g. 'Showing X of Y') at bottom, centered or right-aligned as appropriate.

spacing.system: Prefer a base unit (e.g. 4px or 8px) and derive all spacing from it.

usage.sectionGaps: Consistent vertical gaps between header, table, and pagination (e.g. 24px)
usage.componentGaps: 8–16px between buttons; comfortable horizontal spacing between table columns
usage.verticalRhythm: Consistent gaps between text lines, list rows, and component groups

typography.fontFamily: Modern sans-serif: prefer 'Inter', 'Roboto', or similar. Highly legible with clear weight differentiation.
typography.rule: Never use more than two font families. Differentiate by size and weight, not by switching fonts.

primary.description: Brand accent: primary actions, active states, checked checkboxes
primary.usage: Primary button background, active pagination, checkbox checked

backgrounds.page: Subtle gradient: light blue at top to light violet at bottom. Adds depth; keep very soft.

container.description: Main content card wrapping a view.
container.style: Background white, border-radius 16–24px, subtle drop shadow. Generous internal padding (24–32px).

table.header: Medium weight, dark text; optional small sort chevrons in medium grey.
table.row: White background; thin bottom border (#EEEEEE); hover: subtle light grey/blue fill (#F8FAFC).
table.cellPadding: Comfortable vertical and horizontal padding for readability.

checkbox.unchecked: White background, light grey border (#D1D5DB), small border-radius (4–6px).

statusBadge.padding: Small horizontal and vertical for compact badge.

pagination.active: White text on violet circular/pill background (#6D28D9).

icons.style: Outline/simple; not filled unless indicating state.
icons.color: Match context: white on primary buttons, medium grey (#888888) for secondary actions (e.g. row download).

whenBuildingUI: Always use the color hex values or semantic names from this file; do not invent new greys or purples.
Apply the spacing scale (xs–2xl) for padding and margins; avoid arbitrary values like 13px or 19px.
Use the typography scale for all text; main titles bold and large, body regular, labels/small text in secondary color.
Put primary content in a white card with large border-radius and subtle shadow when the layout matches the reference.
Buttons: primary for main action (violet), secondary for Export-style actions (white + border).
Tables/lists: header row with medium weight, row dividers, hover state. Checkboxes violet when checked.
Status indicators: pill-shaped badges with success (blue-purple) and error (red) as defined.
Pagination: active page with violet background and white text; inactive pages and prev/next in dark grey.
Keep the page background subtle (light gradient) so the white content card stands out.
avoid: Flat, boxy corners on cards and buttons (use the radius scale).
Pure black (#000) for text; use the defined dark greys.
Multiple accent colors; violet/purple is the single primary accent.
Cluttered layouts; preserve white space and hierarchy.
